org.md2k.datakitapi

Class DataKitAPI

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.md2k.datakitapi.DataKitAPI

  • public class DataKitAPI
extends java.lang.Object
    Handles exception checks and handles outside method calls for DataKitAPIExecute.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void connect(OnConnectionListener callerOnConnectionListener)
      Connects DataKit to an outside calling application.
      void disconnect()
      Disconnects DataKit by removing any remaining messages from the Handler, syncing all the data and calls DataKitAPIExecute.disconnect().
      java.util.ArrayList<DataSourceClient> find(DataSourceBuilder dataSourceBuilder)
      Returns an ArrayList of DataSourceClient objects that match the given DataSourceBuilder.
      static DataKitAPI getInstance(android.content.Context context)
      Returns an instance of DataKitAPI.
      void insert(DataSourceClient dataSourceClient, DataType dataType)
      Inserts data into DataKit.
      void insert(DataSourceClient dataSourceClient, DataType[] dataTypes)
      Inserts an array of data into DataKit.
      void insertHighFrequency(DataSourceClient dataSourceClient, DataTypeDoubleArray dataType)
      Inserts the given data source into a high frequency buffer.
      void insertHighFrequency(DataSourceClient dataSourceClient, DataTypeDoubleArray[] dataType)
      Inserts the given data source into a high frequency buffer.
      boolean isConnected()
      Checks if Data Kit is connected to the calling application.
      java.util.ArrayList<DataType> query(DataSourceClient dataSourceClient, int last_n_sample)
      Queries DataKit for the last given number of sample from the given data source.
      java.util.ArrayList<DataType> query(DataSourceClient dataSourceClient, long starttimestamp, long endtimestamp)
      Queries DataKit for samples from the given data source within the given time window.
      java.util.ArrayList<RowObject> queryFromPrimaryKey(DataSourceClient dataSourceClient, long lastSyncedKey, int limit)
      Queries for rows from the database corresponding to the given DataSourceClient and lastSyncedKey.
      DataTypeLong querySize()
      Queries DataKit for the size of the database.
      DataSourceClient register(DataSourceBuilder dataSourceBuilder)
      Registers a DataSourceClient with DataKit and returns that object.
      void setSummary(DataSourceClient dataSourceClient, DataType dataType)
      Sets the summary for the given data in DataKit.
      void subscribe(DataSourceClient dataSourceClient, OnReceiveListener onReceiveListener)
      Subscribes the given DataSourceClient to the given OnReceiveListener.
      Status unregister(DataSourceClient dataSourceClient)
      Unregisters the given data source from DataKit.
      Status unsubscribe(DataSourceClient dataSourceClient)
      Unsubscribes the given DataSourceClient from DataKit.

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static DataKitAPI getInstance(android.content.Context context)
        Returns an instance of DataKitAPI.

        If an instance does not already exist, one is created.

        Parameters:
        context - Android context
        Returns:
        An instance of DataKitAPI

      • isConnected

        public boolean isConnected()
        Checks if Data Kit is connected to the calling application.
        Returns:
        Whether Data Kit is connected.

      • connect

        public void connect(OnConnectionListener callerOnConnectionListener)
             throws DataKitException
        Connects DataKit to an outside calling application.
        Parameters:
        callerOnConnectionListener - Callback for connection verification.
        Throws:
        DataKitException - Thrown when DataKit is not installed.

      • find

        public java.util.ArrayList<DataSourceClient> find(DataSourceBuilder dataSourceBuilder)
                                           throws DataKitException
        Returns an ArrayList of DataSourceClient objects that match the given DataSourceBuilder.
        Parameters:
        dataSourceBuilder - Builder object for the desired DataSourceClient objects.
        Returns:
        An ArrayList of DataSourceClient objects.
        Throws:
        DataKitException - Thrown if Data Kit is not connected, the builder is null, or the clients are null.

      • insert

        public void insert(DataSourceClient dataSourceClient,
                   DataType dataType)
            throws DataKitException
        Inserts data into DataKit.
        Parameters:
        dataSourceClient - Data source to insert.
        dataType - Type of data to insert.
        Throws:
        DataKitException - Thrown if DataKit is not connected and if the DataSourceClient or the DataType are null.

      • setSummary

        public void setSummary(DataSourceClient dataSourceClient,
                       DataType dataType)
                throws DataKitException
        Sets the summary for the given data in DataKit.
        Parameters:
        dataSourceClient - Data source to summarize.
        dataType - Type of the data in dataSourceClient.
        Throws:
        DataKitException - Thrown if DataKit is not connected or the data is invalid.

      • insert

        public void insert(DataSourceClient dataSourceClient,
                   DataType[] dataTypes)
            throws DataKitException
        Inserts an array of data into DataKit.
        Parameters:
        dataSourceClient - Data source to insert.
        dataTypes - Array of DataType objects.
        Throws:
        DataKitException - Thrown if DataKit is not connected or the data is invalid.

      • insertHighFrequency

        public void insertHighFrequency(DataSourceClient dataSourceClient,
                                DataTypeDoubleArray[] dataType)
                         throws DataKitException
        Inserts the given data source into a high frequency buffer.
        Parameters:
        dataSourceClient - Data source to insert.
        dataType - Double array of DataType objects.
        Throws:
        DataKitException - Thrown if DataKit is not connected or the data is invalid.

      • insertHighFrequency

        public void insertHighFrequency(DataSourceClient dataSourceClient,
                                DataTypeDoubleArray dataType)
                         throws DataKitException
        Inserts the given data source into a high frequency buffer.
        Parameters:
        dataSourceClient - Data source to insert.
        dataType - Double array of DataType objects.
        Throws:
        DataKitException - Thrown if DataKit is not connected or the data is invalid.

      • register

        public DataSourceClient register(DataSourceBuilder dataSourceBuilder)
                          throws DataKitException
        Registers a DataSourceClient with DataKit and returns that object.
        Parameters:
        dataSourceBuilder - Builder object of the desired DataSourceClient.
        Returns:
        The registered DataSourceClient.
        Throws:
        DataKitException - Thrown when DataKit is not installed or the data is invalid.

      • unregister

        public Status unregister(DataSourceClient dataSourceClient)
                  throws DataKitException
        Unregisters the given data source from DataKit.
        Parameters:
        dataSourceClient - The data source to unregister.
        Returns:
        The status of the unregistering operation.
        Throws:
        DataKitException - Thrown when DataKit is not installed or the data is invalid.

      • query

        public java.util.ArrayList<DataType> query(DataSourceClient dataSourceClient,
                                           int last_n_sample)
                                    throws DataKitException
        Queries DataKit for the last given number of sample from the given data source.
        Parameters:
        dataSourceClient - The data source whose data is being queried for.
        last_n_sample - Last n samples to retrieve, n is a nonzero positive integer.
        Returns:
        An arrayList of the query results.
        Throws:
        DataKitException - Thrown when DataKit is not installed or the data is invalid.

      • query

        public java.util.ArrayList<DataType> query(DataSourceClient dataSourceClient,
                                           long starttimestamp,
                                           long endtimestamp)
                                    throws DataKitException
        Queries DataKit for samples from the given data source within the given time window.
        Parameters:
        dataSourceClient - The data source whose data is being queried for.
        starttimestamp - The starting timestamp for the desired sampling window.
        endtimestamp - The ending timestamp for the desired sampling window.
        Returns:
        An arrayList of the query results.
        Throws:
        DataKitException - Thrown when DataKit is not installed or the data is invalid.

      • queryFromPrimaryKey

        public java.util.ArrayList<RowObject> queryFromPrimaryKey(DataSourceClient dataSourceClient,
                                                          long lastSyncedKey,
                                                          int limit)
                                                   throws DataKitException
        Queries for rows from the database corresponding to the given DataSourceClient and lastSyncedKey.
        Parameters:
        dataSourceClient - The data source whose data is being queried for.
        lastSyncedKey - Most recent key that was synce to DataKit.
        limit - Number of rows to return.
        Returns:
        An arrayList of the query results.
        Throws:
        DataKitException - Thrown when DataKit is not installed or the data is invalid.

      • querySize

        public DataTypeLong querySize()
                       throws DataKitException
        Queries DataKit for the size of the database.
        Returns:
        The number of columns in the database.
        Throws:
        DataKitException - Thrown when DataKit is not installed or the data is invalid.

      • subscribe

        public void subscribe(DataSourceClient dataSourceClient,
                      OnReceiveListener onReceiveListener)
               throws DataKitException
        Subscribes the given DataSourceClient to the given OnReceiveListener.
        Parameters:
        dataSourceClient - The DataSourceClient to subscribe.
        onReceiveListener - The message handler DataSourceClient is subscribing to.
        Throws:
        DataKitException - Thrown when DataKit isn't connected, when DataSourceClient or onReceiveListener is null.

      • unsubscribe

        public Status unsubscribe(DataSourceClient dataSourceClient)
                   throws DataKitException
        Unsubscribes the given DataSourceClient from DataKit.
        Parameters:
        dataSourceClient - The DataSourceClient to unsubscribe.
        Returns:
        The new status
        Throws:
        DataKitException - Thrown when DataKit is not connected or dataSourceClient is null.

      • disconnect

        public void disconnect()
        Disconnects DataKit by removing any remaining messages from the Handler, syncing all the data and calls DataKitAPIExecute.disconnect().
